(1) The Minister of Transport may give to any person Directionswho carries on [in the United Kingdom] any business comprising with respect tothe carriage of goods or passengers by sea in international waters ^^actssuch directions with respect to the terms and conditions uponwhich contracts may be made by that person for the purposes10 of or in connection with that business as appear to the Ministerto be necessary for preserving Her Majesty's territorial and otherjurisdiction and preventing encroachment thereon.(2) Directions under this section may in particular prohibit the person to whom they are addressed from complying (or from15 complying except to such extent or subject to such conditions asmay be specified in the directions) with any prohibition orrequirement imposed by or under the law of any foreign country with respect to any such terms or conditions as aforesaid(including any requirement so imposed for the submission of any20 contract or other document for approval) in so far as, in theopinion of the Minister, that prohibition or requirement constitutesor may constitute such an encroachment as aforesaid.129-2 42/5 Shipping Contracts and Commercial DocumentsDirectionswith respectto documentsrequired by foreign courts,etc.Offences andlegalproceedings.(3) In this section " contract" includes any arrangement orunderstanding, whether legally enforceable or not.2. (1) If it appears to any Minister of the Crown authorisedto act under this section (a) that any person [who carries on business in the United 5Kingdom] has been or may be required to produce orfurnish to any court, tribunal or other authority of aforeign country any document relating to his business which is not within the territorial jurisdiction of thatcountry, or any written information to be compiled 10from such documents; and(b) that the requirement constitutes or would constitute anencroachment on Her Majesty's territorial or otherjurisdiction,that Minister may give directions to that person prohibiting him 15from complying with the requirement in question, or fromcomplying with that requirement except to such extent or subjectto such conditions as may be specified in the directions.(2) The following Ministers are hereby authorised to act underthis section, that is to say a Secretary of State, the President of 20the Board of Trade, the Minister of Power and the Minister ofTransport.3. (1) Any person who contravenes any direction under thisAct shall be liable on conviction on indictment to a fine notexceeding one thousand pounds or, in the case of a body corporate, 25to a fine of unlimited amount.(2) No proceedings for an offence punishable under thissection shall be instituted in England and Wales or NorthernIreland except by the Minister by whom the directions alleged to be contravened were given, or with the consent of the Attorney 30General or, as the case may be, the Attorney General for NorthernIreland.(3) Proceedings against any person for an offence punishableunder this section may be taken before the appropriate court inthe United Kingdom having jurisdiction in the place where that 35person is for the time being.AlternativeEnforcement 3. Compliance with any directions given under this Act shall of directions, be enforceable by civil proceedings on behalf of the Crown foran injunction or other appropriate relief. 40 Shipping Contracts and Commercial Documents 34.
